CreateBillOfMaterialsImportJob.name: CreateBillOfMaterialsImportJob
CreateBillOfMaterialsImportJob.documentation:
CreateBillOfMaterialsImportJob creates an import job for the Product Bill Of Materials (BOM) entity. For information on the product_bom entity, see the AWS Supply Chain User Guide.

The CSV file must be located in an Amazon S3 location accessible to AWS Supply Chain. It is recommended to use the same Amazon S3 bucket created during your AWS Supply Chain instance creation.

CreateDataIntegrationFlow.name: CreateDataIntegrationFlow
CreateDataIntegrationFlow.documentation: Create DataIntegrationFlow to map one or more different sources to one target using the SQL transformation query.

GetBillOfMaterialsImportJob.name: GetBillOfMaterialsImportJob
GetBillOfMaterialsImportJob.documentation: Get status and details of a BillOfMaterialsImportJob.

ListDataIntegrationFlows.name: ListDataIntegrationFlows
ListDataIntegrationFlows.documentation: Lists all the DataIntegrationFlows in a paginated way.

ListDataLakeDatasets.name: ListDataLakeDatasets
ListDataLakeDatasets.documentation: List the data lake datasets for a specific instance and name space.

ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource.documentation: List all the tags for an Amazon Web ServicesSupply Chain resource.

SendDataIntegrationEvent.name: SendDataIntegrationEvent
SendDataIntegrationEvent.documentation: Send the transactional data payload for the event with real-time data for analysis or monitoring. The real-time data events are stored in an Amazon Web Services service before being processed and stored in data lake. New data events are synced with data lake at 5 PM GMT everyday. The updated transactional data is available in data lake after ingestion.

TagResource.name: TagResource
TagResource.documentation: Create tags for an Amazon Web Services Supply chain resource.

UntagResource.name: UntagResource
UntagResource.documentation: Delete tags for an Amazon Web Services Supply chain resource.

AccessDeniedException.documentation: You do not have the required privileges to perform this action.

s3uri.documentation: The S3 URI from which the CSV is read.

message.documentation: When the BillOfMaterialsImportJob has reached a terminal state, there will be a message.

ClientToken.documentation: Unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.

ConflictException.documentation: Updating or deleting a resource can cause an inconsistent state.

s3uri.documentation: The S3 URI of the CSV file to be imported. The bucket must grant permissions for AWS Supply Chain to read the file.

clientToken.documentation: An idempotency token ensures the API request is only completed no more than once. This way, retrying the request will not trigger the operation multiple times. A client token is a unique, case-sensitive string of 33 to 128 ASCII characters. To make an idempotent API request, specify a client token in the request. You should not reuse the same client token for other requests. If you retry a successful request with the same client token, the request will succeed with no further actions being taken, and you will receive the same API response as the original successful request.

The name space of the dataset.

  • asc - For information on the Amazon Web Services Supply Chain supported datasets see https://docs.aws.amazon.com/aws-supply-chain/latest/userguide/data-model-asc.html.

  • default - For datasets with custom user-defined schemas.

name.documentation: The name of the dataset. For asc name space, the name must be one of the supported data entities under https://docs.aws.amazon.com/aws-supply-chain/latest/userguide/data-model-asc.html.

schema.documentation: The custom schema of the data lake dataset and is only required when the name space is default.

loadType.documentation: The dataset data load type in dataset options.

dedupeRecords.documentation: The dataset load option to remove duplicates.

DataIntegrationFlowDatasetOptions.documentation: The dataset options used in dataset source and target configurations.

fileType.documentation: The Amazon S3 file type in S3 options.

DataIntegrationFlowS3Options.documentation: The Amazon S3 options used in S3 source and target configurations.

prefix.documentation: The prefix of the S3 source objects.

options.documentation: The other options of the S3 DataIntegrationFlow source.

bucketName.documentation: The bucketName of the S3 target objects.

prefix.documentation: The prefix of the S3 target objects.

query.documentation: The transformation SQL query body based on SparkSQL.

sourceName.documentation: The DataIntegrationFlow source name that can be used as table alias in SQL transformation query.

ValidationException.documentation: The input does not satisfy the constraints specified by an AWS service.

documentation:
AWS Supply Chain is a cloud-based application that works with your enterprise resource planning (ERP) and supply chain management systems. Using AWS Supply Chain, you can connect and extract your inventory, supply, and demand related data from existing ERP or supply chain systems into a single data model.

The AWS Supply Chain API supports configuration data import for Supply Planning.

All AWS Supply chain API operations are Amazon-authenticated and certificate-signed. They not only require the use of the AWS SDK, but also allow for the exclusive use of AWS Identity and Access Management users and roles to help facilitate access, trust, and permission policies.
